TopicTitle: How to figure out what science you haven't done?

Articles.Content:
I want to get ALL the science points. So I'm in the Science Archives, looking at all the stuff I've done for Kerbin and it's confusing as hell. It shows what I've done, but nothing like a checklist of all possible science points.

1) There is note under the science dude on the Science Archives page that says I've done X science reports out of a total of 238, based on if I'm looking at Exeriments, Situations or Biomes. Ooooook, but (for example) how many Biome science reports are there? How many actual situations are there?

1a) why are some reports hidden and how do I unhide them?

2) Finally, what's the most efficient way of collecting science points. My tech tree is complete, and I attached all the science devices to my ships. Should I take multiple Goo and Materials Study containers and maximize science points all at once or what?

I know it can be confusing, however that's what the wiki is for, take a look this might help! WIKI AWAY!!!!

1) This might help There are only biomes on Kerbin, The Mun, and Minnmus

1a) I have no idea about hidden report? I didn't even know that was a thing D:

2) This is all about preference, do it how you want to. You asked for most efficient, personally it is attaching multipule one-use-only things (goo, materials study). along with a science module. However some people might go with satalite items, and just transmit and make them crash into the surface. Like I said it is all about preference.

Hope this helps!!!

Laugh a little it makes the 'splosions more awesome!

Edited July 3, 2014 by austin4050
didn't answer all questions

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/78305-0-23-5-Science-Library-v1-2

This mod, through Blizzy's toolbar, displays all science you have don, can do, and allows you to sort it all quite easily. It also displays points from incremental experiments such as Materials Bay, Goo containers, which you can run several times with diminishing returns, showing how much you have already gained from them, and how many are left.

i can recommend you this mod:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/78305-0-23-5-Science-Library-v1-2

this helps you to find out all the science left.

EDIT: yes someone was faster than me

I prefer this one to science library. It actually lets you know there is science available where you are right now with an icon alert and sound and even kills warp. You can use them both together though.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76793-0-23-5-ScienceAlert-Experiment-availability-feedback

Edited July 3, 2014 by Alshain

I prefer this one to science library. It actually lets you know there is science available where you are right now.

Science Library also lets you know what science is available right now. It displays an entire list with percent completed for each experiment.

Science Library also lets you know what science is available right now. It displays an entire list with percent completed for each experiment.

But you have to have a window open to see it and it doesn't kill warp.

I recommend using this website:

http://kerbal-science-remaining.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/

Just find your save file (persistent or quick-save) and drop it on the page.
OOOh, a Science mod, of course. Thanks y'all!

Also this if you want a paper/excel way to track.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/84418-KSP-Science-Checklist
